intro: Melampodium minutiflorum, commonly known as the dwarf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow to orange flower heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open woodlands and sandy soils. Its small flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
